Download GEO Data Resources

Source: R/download_geo_data.R
download_geo_data.Rd

Downloads comprehensive GEO (Gene Expression Omnibus) data resources including GSEMatrix (expression data), supplemental files, and GPL (platform) annotation files. Provides robust error handling, retry mechanisms, and detailed logging capabilities.

Usage

download_geo_data(
  gse_id,
  dest_dir = "data/raw",
  overwrite = FALSE,
  log = TRUE,
  log_file = NULL,
  retries = 2,
  timeout = 300
)

Arguments

gse_id

Character string. GEO Series accession ID (e.g., "GSE12345"). Must follow the standard GEO accession format.

dest_dir

Character string. Destination directory for downloaded files. Defaults to "data/raw". Directory will be created if it doesn't exist.

overwrite

Logical. Whether to overwrite existing files. Defaults to FALSE. Note: This parameter is currently not used in the implementation.

log

Logical. Whether to record detailed log information. Defaults to TRUE.

log_file

Character string or NULL. Path to log file. If NULL (default), automatically generates a timestamped log file in "logs/geo/" directory.

retries

Numeric. Number of retry attempts on download failure. Defaults to 2. Must be a non-negative integer.

timeout

Numeric. Timeout in seconds for each download attempt. Defaults to 300 (5 minutes). Must be positive.

Value

A list with four components:

gse_object

ExpressionSet object from GEOquery containing expression data, sample annotations, and feature information.

supplemental_files

Character vector of file paths to downloaded supplemental files (e.g., raw data files, processed data).

platform_info

List containing platform information with elements:

platform_id

Character string. GPL accession ID of the platform used.

gpl_files

Character vector of file paths to downloaded GPL annotation files.

meta

List containing comprehensive metadata about the download process:

gse_id

GEO accession ID

dest_dir

Destination directory path

downloaded_at

POSIXct timestamp when download started

completed_at

POSIXct timestamp when download completed

download_duration

Numeric. Total download time in seconds

retries

Number of retry attempts configured

timeout

Timeout setting in seconds

status

Character. Download status ("success")

gse_samples

Integer. Number of samples in GSEMatrix

gse_features

Integer. Number of features/genes in GSEMatrix

supplemental_files_count

Integer. Number of supplemental files downloaded

platform_id

Character. Platform annotation ID

gpl_files_count

Integer. Number of GPL files downloaded

total_files_downloaded

Integer. Total number of files downloaded

Details

This function provides a comprehensive solution for downloading GEO data resources:

Data Types Downloaded

  1. GSEMatrix: Expression data in ExpressionSet format containing expression values, sample metadata, and feature annotations

  2. Supplemental Files: Additional data files associated with the GEO series (raw data, processed data, etc.)

  3. GPL Files: Platform annotation files containing probe/gene mappings and annotation information

Robustness Features

  1. Retry Mechanism: Automatic retry with exponential backoff for failed downloads

  2. Timeout Control: Configurable timeout for each download attempt

  3. Error Handling: Comprehensive error handling with informative messages

  4. Logging: Detailed logging with timestamps and severity levels

  5. Parameter Validation: Thorough validation of all input parameters

Dependencies

Required R packages (automatically checked at runtime):

  1. GEOquery: For accessing GEO data (install with BiocManager::install('GEOquery'))

  2. Biobase: For handling ExpressionSet objects (install with BiocManager::install('Biobase'))

  3. withr: For timeout management (install with install.packages('withr'))

  4. cli: For user-friendly console output (install with install.packages('cli'))

File Organization

Downloaded files are organized as follows:


dest_dir/
â”œâ”€â”€ GSE<id>_series_matrix.txt.gz    # GSEMatrix file
â”œâ”€â”€ GPL<id>.annot.gz               # Platform annotation (if available)
â”œâ”€â”€ <supplemental_files>           # Additional data files
â””â”€â”€ logs/geo/                      # Log files (if logging enabled)
    â””â”€â”€ GSE<id>_<date>.log

References

https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/geo/

Barrett T, Wilhite SE, Ledoux P, Evangelista C, Kim IF, Tomashevsky M, Marshall KA, Phillippy KH, Sherman PM, Holko M, Yefanov A, Lee H, Zhang N, Robertson CL, Serova N, Davis S, Soboleva A. NCBI GEO: archive for functional genomics data setsâ€“update. Nucleic Acids Res. 2013 Jan; 41(Database issue):D991-5.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Basic usage - download with default settings
result <- download_geo_data("GSE12345")

# Advanced usage with custom settings
result <- download_geo_data(
  gse_id = "GSE7305",
  dest_dir = "data/geo_downloads",
  log = TRUE,
  retries = 3,
  timeout = 600
)

# Access downloaded data
expr_data <- Biobase::exprs(result$gse_object)
sample_info <- Biobase::pData(result$gse_object)
feature_info <- Biobase::fData(result$gse_object)

# Check download metadata
cat("Download took:", result$meta$download_duration, "seconds\n")
cat("Downloaded", result$meta$total_files_downloaded, "files\n")
} # }
